title: Nominations sent to the Senate, 3/31/09 | whitehouse.gov
content:
The White House




March 31, 2009

 



Nominations sent to the Senate, 3/31/09




THE WHITE HOUSE   Office of the Press Secretary  ___________________________________________________________________  FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE                                         March 31, 2009  NOMINATIONS SENT TO THE SENATE:   Thomas E. Perez, of Maryland, to be an Assistant Attorney General, vice Wan J. Kim.   Lawrence E. Strickling, of Illinois, to be Assistant Secretary of Commerce for Communications and Information, vice John M. R. Kneuer.   Hilary Chandler Tompkins, of New Mexico, to be Solicitor of the Department of the Interior, vice David Longly Bernhardt, resigned.   Ines R. Triay, of New Mexico, to be an Assistant Secretary of Energy (Environmental Management), vice James A. Rispoli, resigned.  WITHDRAWAL SENT TO THE SENATE:   Jonathan Z. Cannon, of Virginia, to be Deputy Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency, vice Marcus C. Peacock, resigned, which was sent to the Senate on March 11, 2009.
